days.title: Departure from Wroc≈Çaw
days.tagline: Two flights, one dream. Korea & Japan, here we come.
highlights: Pack snacks ‚Äî it's a long journey!
days.food: Airport food in Copenhagen. Stock up on snacks for the long haul to Seoul.
days.tip: Copenhagen has good duty-free. Grab Danish pastries for the Seoul flight.

days.title: Arrival in Seoul
days.tagline: Annyeonghaseyo! Landing in the city that never sleeps.
highlights: AREX train to Seoul Station ‚Äî 43 min, ‚Ç©9,500
Evening walk ‚Äî Myeongdong or Namdaemun Market
days.food: Late dinner: Korean BBQ near hotel, or street food at Myeongdong (tteokbokki, hotteok).
days.tip: Get a T-money card at the airport for all public transport in Seoul.

days.title: Seoul: Palaces & K-Culture
days.tagline: Ancient palaces meet neon-lit streets. Seoul is a time machine.
highlights: 13:00 ‚Äî Insadong ‚Äî art galleries, tea houses, street food
15:00 ‚Äî Namsan Tower (N Seoul Tower) ‚Äî city panorama

transport.note: Seoul Metro ‚Äî T-money card works everywhere

days.food: Lunch: bibimbap at Insadong. Dinner: Korean fried chicken in Hongdae (try Kyochon or BBQ).
days.tip: Rent hanbok near Gyeongbokgung for free palace entry + amazing photo ops.

days.title: Seoul ‚Üí Tokyo
days.tagline: Two capitals in one day. Seoul to Tokyo in 2 hours flat.
highlights: 10:20 ‚Äî Arrive Tokyo, train to hotel in K≈çt≈ç-ku
18:00 ‚Äî First ramen in Tokyo. Welcome to Japan.
days.food: Welcome-to-Japan ramen ‚Äî find a local spot near the hotel. Konbini for snacks.
days.tip: Buy Suica/PASMO card at the airport. Get pocket WiFi too.

days.title: Tokyo: Full Immersion
days.tagline: From kitchen streets to Shibuya crossing. Tokyo at full speed.
highlights: 10:30 ‚Äî Kappabashi D≈çgugai Kitchen Town ‚Äî knife shopping!
12:00 ‚Äî Ueno Park ‚Äî temples, shrines, cherry trees
14:00 ‚Äî Gotokuji Temple ‚Äî the lucky cat temple
18:00 ‚Äî Shibuya Crossing ‚Üí Shibuya Sky observation deck ‚Äî ¬•2,000

transport.note: Tokyo Metro ‚Äî Suica card. Lots of walking!

days.food: Kappabashi area for lunch. Shibuya for dinner ‚Äî try tonkatsu or gyudon. FamilyMart for midnight snacks.
days.tip: This is an INTENSE day. Prioritize your top 6-7 spots and save the rest for Day 7.

days.title: Kamakura & Mount Fuji
days.tagline: Zen temples in the morning, Fuji-san by afternoon. Epic day trip.
highlights: 15:30 ‚Äî ≈åishi Park ‚Äî lakeside flower park with Fuji views
16:30 ‚Äî Mt. Fuji Panoramic Ropeway ‚Äî cable car over Kawaguchiko
days.food: Kamakura: shirasu-don (whitebait rice bowl) ‚Äî local specialty. Fuji area: h≈çt≈ç noodles.
days.tip: This is geographically ambitious (Kamakura is south, Fuji is west). Consider splitting or renting a car for Fuji portion.

days.title: Tokyo Morning ‚Üí Kyoto
days.tagline: Imperial gardens, then shinkansen west. Next stop: ancient capital.
highlights: 08:30 ‚Äî Imperial Palace East Gardens ‚Äî free, beautiful
10:00 ‚Äî Chidorigafuchi ‚Äî moat walk, iconic cherry blossom spot
12:00 ‚Äî Lunch in Tokyo, pack up hotel
16:15 ‚Äî Arrive Kyoto, check into KOKO Residence near Nij≈ç-j≈ç
days.food: Last Tokyo lunch ‚Äî sushi near the station. Kyoto evening: tofu kaiseki or simple ramen.
days.tip: Shinkansen tickets with JR Pass ‚Äî take Hikari (not Nozomi). Reserve window seat for views.

days.title: Kyoto: Temples, Art & Geisha Streets
days.tagline: Golden pavilions, digital art, and the sound of wooden geta on stone.
highlights: 10:00 ‚Äî teamLab Biovortex Kyoto ‚Äî immersive digital art
12:00 ‚Äî Kyoto Imperial Palace ‚Äî free, reserve online
14:00 ‚Äî Hanamikoji Street ‚Äî geisha district, traditional feel
15:00 ‚Äî Yasaka Shrine ‚Üí K≈çdai-ji ‚Üí Yasaka Pagoda walk

transport.note: Kyoto city buses + walking. Buy a bus day pass ¬•700.

days.food: Nishiki Market for lunch grazing. Evening: Pontocho alley along the river.
days.tip: Kinkaku-ji at 8:30am is magical with morning light. teamLab books out ‚Äî get tickets in advance!

days.title: Nara: Sacred Deer & Giant Buddha
days.tagline: Bow to the deer, they bow back. Then meet the world's largest bronze Buddha.
highlights: 09:30 ‚Äî T≈çdai-ji ‚Äî world's largest wooden building, giant Buddha ‚Äî ¬•600
11:00 ‚Äî Todaiji Kaidan Hall ‚Äî quieter, beautiful statues
14:00 ‚Äî Mount Wakakusa ‚Äî panoramic hike (30 min climb, free)
days.food: Nara: kakinoha-zushi (leaf-wrapped sushi), mochi from street vendors. Dinner back in Kyoto.
days.tip: Buy deer crackers (shika senbei, ¬•200) at official stands only. Deer are gentle but persistent!

days.title: Osaka: Food Capital of Japan
days.tagline: Kuidaore ‚Äî eat until you drop. Osaka takes this literally.
highlights: 09:30 ‚Äî Umeda Sky Building ‚Äî floating garden observatory ‚Äî ¬•1,500
11:00 ‚Äî Osaka Castle ‚Äî ¬•600, park is free and gorgeous
13:00 ‚Äî D≈çtonbori ‚Äî neon madness, street food heaven
16:00 ‚Äî Namba Yasaka Jinja ‚Äî giant lion head shrine
19:30 ‚Äî Harukas 300 ‚Äî Japan's tallest building observation deck ‚Äî ¬•1,500
days.food: D≈çtonbori: takoyaki (Kukuru), okonomiyaki (Mizuno), gyoza. Kuromon: fresh sashimi. Shinsekai: kushikatsu at Daruma.
days.tip: D≈çtonbori at night is ELECTRIC. Come back after Harukas for the neon madness.

days.title: Epic West: Himeji ‚Üí Onomichi ‚Üí Hiroshima ‚Üí Fukuoka
days.tagline: Four cities, one day. The shinkansen earns its keep today.
highlights: 08:30 ‚Äî Himeji Castle ‚Äî Japan's most beautiful castle ‚Äî ¬•1,000
10:30 ‚Äî Train to Onomichi ‚Äî ~1.5h ‚Äî charming port town
12:00 ‚Äî Onomichi Temple Walk ‚Äî hillside path with sea views
14:30 ‚Äî A-Bomb Dome & Peace Memorial ‚Äî powerful, essential
18:00 ‚Äî Arrive Fukuoka, check in. Yatai ramen dinner!
days.food: Onomichi: onomichi ramen (pork back fat!). Hiroshima: quick okonomiyaki. Fukuoka: yatai Hakata ramen ‚Äî the grand finale.
days.tip: This is the marathon day. Pack light, send big luggage via takkyubin (luggage forwarding) to Fukuoka hotel.

days.title: Kyushu Adventures: Rice Terraces to Hot Hells
days.tagline: Terraced rice fields, samurai castles, and boiling hot springs from hell.
highlights: 07:30 ‚Äî Drive/train to Eriyama Rice Terraces ‚Äî stunning sunrise paddy views
09:00 ‚Äî Dazaifu Tenmangu ‚Äî shrine of the learning god
10:30 ‚Äî Nyoirinji Frog Temple ‚Äî quirky, thousands of frog statues
14:30 ‚Äî Train to Yufuin ‚Äî charming onsen town
16:00 ‚Äî Beppu Jigoku (Hells of Beppu) ‚Äî steaming hot spring pools ‚Äî ¬•2,000
days.food: Kumamoto: basashi (horse sashimi) & karashi renkon. Beppu: jigoku-mushi (hell-steamed food ‚Äî cooked in hot spring steam!).
days.tip: This is VERY ambitious. Consider splitting: Dazaifu+Kumamoto one day, Yufuin+Beppu another. Or rent a car.

days.title: Takachiho Gorge & Mount Aso
days.tagline: Mythological gorges and an active volcano. Nature at its most dramatic.
highlights: 09:00 ‚Äî Takachiho Gorge ‚Äî boat ride through volcanic ravine ‚Äî ¬•5,100/3 people
11:00 ‚Äî Amano Iwato Shrine ‚Äî cave of the sun goddess
13:00 ‚Äî Lunch in Takachiho ‚Äî local chicken nanban
14:30 ‚Äî Aso-Kuju National Park ‚Äî volcanic crater views
days.food: Takachiho: chicken nanban, nagashi somen (flowing noodles). Aso: red beef (akaushi).
days.tip: Takachiho boat ride books out fast! The gorge is otherworldly ‚Äî worth every yen.

days.title: Fukuoka Chill ‚Üí Okinawa
days.tagline: Zoo monkeys in the morning, tropical beaches by evening.
highlights: 10:30 ‚Äî Atago Shrine ‚Äî hilltop shrine with city views
17:00 ‚Äî Arrive Naha, check into Southern Beach Hotel
days.food: Fukuoka last lunch: mentaiko (spicy cod roe) everything. Okinawa dinner: goya champuru, Orion beer.
days.tip: Southern Beach Hotel has a great beach. Relax ‚Äî you've earned it after the Kyushu marathon.

days.title: Okinawa: Island Paradise
days.tagline: Tropical Japan. Turquoise water, Ryukyu castles, and island time.
highlights: 09:00 ‚Äî Shuri Castle ‚Äî UNESCO World Heritage, Ryukyu Kingdom ‚Äî ¬•400
11:00 ‚Äî Kokusai Street ‚Äî souvenirs, Okinawan craft beer
12:30 ‚Äî Makishi Public Market ‚Äî fresh seafood upstairs cooking

transport.note: Okinawa has no trains outside Naha monorail. Rent a car for Churaumi (2h drive) or take express bus.

days.food: Makishi Market: pick fish downstairs, they cook it upstairs. Dinner: umibudo (sea grapes), rafute (pork belly), Okinawa soba.
days.tip: Churaumi Aquarium is 2h from Naha. Start early or rent a car. The whale shark tank is breathtaking.

days.title: Okinawa ‚Üí Seoul
days.tagline: One last island morning, then back to Seoul for the final night.
highlights: 18:00 ‚Äî Quick hotel check-in near Gangnam or Myeongdong
19:00 ‚Äî Final Korean BBQ feast ‚Äî go all out!
days.food: Last Korean BBQ: try samgyeopsal (pork belly) with soju. This is the farewell feast.
days.tip: Seoul is a great city for a final night out. Gangnam or Itaewon for nightlife.

days.title: Seoul Last Day & Departure
days.tagline: Morning kimchi, afternoon shopping, midnight flight home.
highlights: 09:00 ‚Äî Late breakfast ‚Äî Korean juk (porridge) or brunch
16:00 ‚Äî Pack up, hotel checkout, head to airport
days.food: Gwangjang Market is a MUST ‚Äî bibimbap, japchae, sundae (blood sausage). K-beauty shopping on the side.
days.tip: Late flight means a full day in Seoul! Use it. Leave bags at hotel or station lockers.

days.title: Welcome Home
highlights: Unpack, sort photos, start planning the next trip
days.food: Home-cooked comfort food. You deserve it.
days.tip: Start a shared photo album ASAP while memories are fresh. And wash everything ‚Äî 18 days!

jrPassAnalysis.recommendation: 7-day or 14-day JR Pass depending on activation date strategy
jrPassAnalysis.note: Activate on Day 7 (Tokyo‚ÜíKyoto) for 7-day. Covers through Day 13.

transport.suicaCard: Buy Suica at Tokyo airport, T-money at Seoul airport

bookings.note: 1,300 PLN pp ‚Äî exchange at Tokyo station
May 1 ‚Äî 1 night near airport or Myeongdong

Hotels (15 nights).note: 5,400 PLN total / 7 people ‚Äî incredibly cheap for 15 nights!

Food.note: 18 days of eating ‚Äî mix of street food, markets, restaurants

Activities.note: Temples, museums, teamLab, Churaumi, boat rides

Local transport.note: T-money Seoul, Suica Tokyo, buses, taxis

budget.note: Hotels are amazingly cheap because 7 people share costs! Flights from CSV: total 2,206 PLN pp.

packing: Comfortable walking shoes (20k+ steps some days)
Universal adapter (Type A for Japan, Type C/F for Korea)

hotels.note: 7 adults sharing accommodations ‚Äî apartment-style preferred. Prices are total per booking, not per night.

options.name: Bilribeu Indosity Namsan
options.pickReason: Already booked! Great location for Namsan + Myeongdong.

options.name: Hotel J≈ç (K≈çt≈ç-ku)
options.pickReason: Already booked! Good value for 3 nights in Tokyo.

kyoto.purpose: Kansai base ‚Äî Kyoto, Nara, Osaka day trips

options.name: KOKO Residence Nij≈ç-j≈ç
options.pickReason: Already booked! Apartment with kitchen near Nij≈ç-j≈ç. Perfect for 7 people.

fukuoka.purpose: Kyushu base ‚Äî Kumamoto, Beppu, Takachiho day trips

options.name: Fukuoka Accommodation (TBD)
highlights: Near Hakata Station for day trips
options.pickReason: Not yet booked ‚Äî book near Hakata Station for easy day trip access.

options.name: Southern Beach Hotel & Resort
options.pickReason: Already booked! Beach resort with pool. Perfect wind-down after Kyushu.

restaurants.note: 40+ curated picks across Korea & Japan ‚Äî from street food to splurge-worthy
restaurants.allergyCardEn: I have allergies ‚Äî please check ingredients

spots.name: Gwangjang Market
spots.mustTry: Bindaetteok (mung bean pancakes), mayak gimbap, japchae
spots.note: Historic market ‚Äî legendary street food. Go to the inner alleys for the best stalls.

spots.name: Myeongdong Gyoja
spots.mustTry: Handmade kalguksu (knife-cut noodles) + steamed mandu
spots.note: Always packed, always worth it. Cash only.

spots.name: Tosokchon Samgyetang
spots.mustTry: Ginseng chicken soup ‚Äî whole chicken stuffed with rice & ginseng
spots.note: Near Gyeongbokgung Palace. Queue up at 11am to beat the lunch rush.

spots.name: Maple Tree House
spots.mustTry: Premium galbi (beef short ribs), bulgogi
spots.note: Upscale KBBQ ‚Äî worth the splurge for the farewell dinner on Day 16.

spots.name: Kyochon Chicken (Hongdae)
spots.mustTry: Honey soy fried chicken + draft beer
spots.note: Korea's best fried chicken chain. Every local has an opinion on best flavor.

spots.name: Myeongdong Street Food Alley
spots.mustTry: Tteokbokki, hotteok (sweet pancakes), egg bread, tornado potato
spots.note: Tourist area but genuinely great ‚Äî grab everything and walk.

spots.name: Jokbal Alley (Jangchung-dong)
spots.mustTry: Braised pork trotters (jokbal) ‚Äî sliced thin, incredibly tender
spots.note: Near your hotel! Late-night specialty street ‚Äî best after midnight.

spots.name: Afuri Ramen
spots.mustTry: Yuzu shio ramen ‚Äî light, citrusy, refreshing
spots.note: Perfect first ramen in Japan. Multiple locations; Ebisu original is coziest.

spots.name: Ichiran Ramen
spots.mustTry: Solo booth tonkotsu ‚Äî customize firmness, richness, garlic, spice
spots.note: Iconic experience ‚Äî order from vending machine, eat in your private booth.

spots.name: Ueno Ameyoko Market
spots.mustTry: Fresh fruit, chocolate-covered strawberries, seafood skewers
spots.note: Near Ueno Park ‚Äî perfect for Day 5 refueling.

spots.name: Nonbei Yokocho
spots.mustTry: Yakitori + highball in tiny 6-seat bars
spots.note: Atmospheric alley bars near Shibuya station. Each bar seats ~6 people.

spots.name: Tsukiji Outer Market
spots.mustTry: Fresh sushi breakfast, tamagoyaki (sweet omelet), grilled scallops
spots.note: The outer market is still thriving! Best visited 7-10am.

spots.name: Tonkatsu Maisen
spots.mustTry: Kurobuta (heritage pork) cutlet ‚Äî crispy, juicy perfection
spots.note: In a converted 1965 bathhouse. Get the kurobuta set.

spots.name: Genki Sushi
spots.mustTry: Tablet-order sushi delivered by miniature bullet train
spots.note: Fun group experience ‚Äî budget sushi that's genuinely good.

spots.name: Fuunji Tsukemen
spots.mustTry: Thick noodles dipped in intense fish-pork broth
spots.note: One of Tokyo's most popular tsukemen spots. Line moves fast.

spots.name: Harajuku Takeshita Cr√™pes
spots.mustTry: Matcha + strawberry cr√™pe, cotton candy, rainbow drinks
spots.note: Kawaii culture epicenter ‚Äî desserts are Instagram-ready.

spots.name: Bowls (Kamakura Shirasu)
spots.mustTry: Raw or boiled whitebait on rice ‚Äî Kamakura's signature dish
spots.note: Best near Komachi-dori street. Only available when fresh catch arrives.

spots.name: H≈çt≈ç Fud≈ç
spots.mustTry: Flat udon in hearty miso with pumpkin ‚Äî Yamanashi soul food
spots.note: Rustic restaurant with Fuji views. The pumpkin h≈çt≈ç is incredible.

spots.name: Nishiki Market
spots.mustTry: Pickles, yuba (tofu skin), dashimaki tamago, matcha sweets
spots.note: The Kitchen of Kyoto ‚Äî 5 blocks of food heaven. Arrive by 10am.

spots.name: Pontocho Alley
spots.mustTry: River-view dining ‚Äî any restaurant with a terrace here
spots.note: Atmospheric narrow alley along Kamo River. Perfect for sunset dinner.

spots.name: Gion Kappa
spots.mustTry: Casual Gion izakaya ‚Äî affordable Kyoto kaiseki-style tapas
spots.note: Hidden gem in Gion. Get the seasonal set menu.

spots.name: Ippudo Ramen Kyoto
spots.mustTry: Rich tonkotsu with Kyoto-style refinement
spots.note: Quick, reliable, late-night option. The shiromaru is classic.

spots.name: Musubi Cafe
spots.mustTry: Artisan onigiri with creative fillings + matcha latte
spots.note: Perfect morning fuel before temple hopping.

spots.name: Sagano Tofu Restaurant
spots.mustTry: Silken yudofu (hot tofu) in dashi ‚Äî Kyoto's iconic vegetarian dish
spots.note: Traditional tatami room. Vegetarian-friendly.

spots.name: Nakatanidou
spots.mustTry: Yomogi mochi ‚Äî freshly pounded at lightning speed
spots.note: Famous high-speed mochi pounding. The green mochi is warm and chewy.

spots.name: Kakinoha-zushi Tanaka
spots.mustTry: Persimmon leaf-wrapped sushi ‚Äî Nara's signature pressed sushi
spots.note: Subtle, vinegary, beautiful. Get the mackerel and salmon variety box.

spots.name: Harushika Sake Brewery
spots.mustTry: 5 sake varieties tasting for ¬•500 ‚Äî keep the cup
spots.note: Near Kasuga Taisha. Great way to end the Nara day.

spots.name: Kuromon Market
spots.mustTry: Fresh uni, wagyu skewers, king crab legs, mango on a stick
spots.note: Osaka's kitchen ‚Äî eat everything. Budget ¬•3,000-5,000 for a full graze.

spots.name: Daruma Kushikatsu
spots.mustTry: Kushikatsu ‚Äî breaded & fried everything. NO double dipping!
spots.note: Look for the angry chef statue. ¬•100-200 per skewer.

spots.name: Kukuru Takoyaki
spots.mustTry: Giant takoyaki with real octopus chunks ‚Äî crispy outside, molten inside
spots.note: Best takoyaki in D≈çtonbori. Get the 8-piece original set.

spots.name: Mizuno Okonomiyaki
spots.mustTry: Osaka-style savory pancake ‚Äî the yamaimoyaki is legendary
spots.note: Since 1945. Expect a line but it moves fast. Worth every minute.

spots.name: Rikuro's Cheesecake
spots.mustTry: Jiggly fluffy cheesecake ‚Äî ¬•965 for a whole cake
spots.note: Watch them brand each cake. Buy one to share on the train.

spots.name: Creo-ru Curry
spots.mustTry: Rich, thick Osaka-style curry ‚Äî comfort food done right
spots.note: Near Namba station. The katsu curry is the move.

spots.name: Ichibirian
spots.mustTry: Takoyaki-flavored everything ‚Äî chips, cookies, sauce
spots.note: Best Osaka souvenir shop. Try the 551 HORAI nikuman (pork bun).

spots.name: Nakasu Yatai Stalls
spots.mustTry: Hakata tonkotsu ramen from open-air river stalls
spots.note: Iconic! Sit at the counter, order kaedama (extra noodles). Best after 8pm.

spots.name: Shin Shin Ramen
spots.mustTry: Rich, creamy tonkotsu ‚Äî local favorite over tourist spots
spots.note: Near Hakata Station. The 'cappuccino foam' on the broth is their signature.

spots.name: Tenjin Horumon
spots.mustTry: Grilled beef intestines ‚Äî Fukuoka specialty, surprisingly addictive
spots.note: Lively atmosphere. Order the mixed horumon plate + rice.

spots.name: Mentaiko Fukutaro
spots.mustTry: Spicy cod roe everything ‚Äî on rice, in pasta, as souvenirs
spots.note: Fukuoka's signature flavor. Buy packs to take home!

spots.name: Beppu Jigoku-mushi Workshop
spots.mustTry: Cook eggs, corn, crab in volcanic hot spring steam yourself!
spots.note: Only in Beppu! Bring your own ingredients or buy at the shop.

spots.name: Kumamoto Akaushi Steak
spots.mustTry: Aso red beef (akaushi) ‚Äî leaner, beefier than other wagyu
spots.note: Day 12/13 Kumamoto stop. Look for restaurants near the castle.

spots.name: Makishi Public Market
spots.mustTry: Pick fish downstairs, they cook it upstairs ‚Äî unique experience
spots.note: 2nd floor cooking fee ~¬•500/dish. Get the gurukun (banana fish) fried.

spots.name: Yunangi
spots.mustTry: Goya champuru, rafute (pork belly), umibudo (sea grapes)
spots.note: Best traditional Okinawan food in Naha. Reserve if possible.

spots.name: Pork Tamago Onigiri
spots.mustTry: Okinawan spam + egg rice ball ‚Äî fast, cheap, iconic
spots.note: Multiple locations on Kokusai-dori. Perfect grab-and-go breakfast.

spots.name: Sam's by the Sea
spots.mustTry: American-Okinawan surf & turf with ocean views
spots.note: Near the American bases ‚Äî authentic 1960s steakhouse vibe.

spots.name: Jack's Steak House
spots.mustTry: Old-school Okinawan-American steakhouse, Teppanyaki steak set
spots.note: Since 1953. The ¬•1,000 steak set is legendary value.

spots.name: Blue Seal Ice Cream
spots.mustTry: Okinawan flavors: beni-imo (purple sweet potato), salt cookie, shiquasa
spots.note: Okinawa's answer to Baskin Robbins. The beni-imo is a must.

statusDescriptions.nearRoute: Near the route ‚Äî worth a detour

items.name: Namdaemun Market
items.note: One of Korea's oldest & largest markets

items.name: Gyeongbokgung Palace
items.note: Main royal palace ‚Äî free in hanbok! ‚Ç©3,000

items.name: Insadong
items.note: Art galleries, tea houses, calligraphy shops

items.name: Hongdae
items.note: K-culture hub ‚Äî buskers, clubs, indie shops

items.name: Intermediatheque
items.note: Free! Stunning natural history museum in old post office

items.name: Kappabashi Kitchen Town
items.note: Knife shopping paradise ‚Äî Japanese kitchen tools

items.name: Gotokuji Temple
items.note: The lucky cat temple ‚Äî thousands of maneki-neko

items.name: Tsurugaoka Hachimang≈´
items.note: Grand Shinto shrine ‚Äî Kamakura's spiritual center

items.name: ≈åishi Park
items.note: Lakeside flower park with Mt Fuji views

items.name: Imperial Palace East Gardens
items.note: Free, beautiful gardens of the Emperor's residence

items.name: Chidorigafuchi
items.note: Iconic moat walk ‚Äî cherry blossom spot

items.name: T≈çdai-ji (Great Buddha)
items.note: World's largest wooden building + giant Buddha ‚Äî ¬•600

items.name: Onomichi Temple Walk
items.note: Hillside path with Inland Sea views

items.name: A-Bomb Dome
items.note: Hiroshima Peace Memorial ‚Äî UNESCO World Heritage

items.name: Dazaifu Tenmangu
items.note: Shrine of the god of learning

items.name: Yufuin
items.note: Charming onsen town at foot of Mt Yufu

items.name: Takachiho Gorge
items.note: Boat ride through volcanic ravine ‚Äî ¬•5,100/3 ppl

items.name: Amano Iwato Shrine
items.note: Cave of the sun goddess ‚Äî Shinto mythology

items.name: Kokusai Street
items.note: Main shopping street ‚Äî souvenirs, craft beer

items.name: Makishi Public Market
items.note: Pick fish downstairs, they cook it upstairs

items.name: Bilribeu Indosity Namsan
items.note: Seoul base: 2 nights, ‚Ç©1,200,000 total. Near Namsan Tower.

items.name: Hotel J≈ç (K≈çt≈ç-ku)
items.note: Tokyo base: 3 nights, ¬•1,000 total. K≈çt≈ç waterfront.

items.name: KOKO Residence Nij≈ç-j≈ç
items.note: Kyoto base: 4 nights, ¬•900 total. Apartment near Nij≈ç Castle, kitchen!

items.name: Fukuoka Hotel (TBD)
items.note: Kyushu base: 3 nights, ¬•800 budget. Near Hakata Station. NOT YET BOOKED!

items.name: Southern Beach Hotel & Resort
items.note: Okinawa base: 2 nights, ¬•700 total. Beachfront in Itoman.

items.name: Seoul Return Hotel (TBD)
items.note: 1 final night in Seoul before flight. Not yet booked.

items.name: Tosokchon Samgyetang
items.note: Iconic ginseng chicken soup ‚Äî line up early!

items.name: Maple Tree House
items.note: Upscale Korean BBQ ‚Äî premium galbi. Farewell feast!

items.name: Kyochon Chicken Hongdae
items.note: Legendary Korean fried chicken ‚Äî honey soy or spicy

items.name: Afuri Ramen (Ebisu)
items.note: Yuzu shio ramen ‚Äî light, citrusy. Perfect first ramen.

items.name: Ueno Ameyoko Market
items.note: Street food: chocolate strawberries, fresh fruit, seafood

items.name: Shibuya Nonbei Yokocho
items.note: Tiny atmospheric yakitori alleys near Shibuya

items.name: Ichiran Ramen Shibuya
items.note: Solo booth tonkotsu ramen ‚Äî customize your bowl

items.name: Tonkatsu Maisen (Omotesando)
items.note: Legendary deep-fried pork cutlet ‚Äî converted bathhouse

items.name: Kamakura Shirasu-don
items.note: Whitebait rice bowl ‚Äî Kamakura's famous local dish

items.name: H≈çt≈ç Fud≈ç (Kawaguchiko)
items.note: Flat udon noodles in miso ‚Äî Yamanashi specialty

items.name: Nishiki Market
items.note: Kyoto's Kitchen ‚Äî pickles, yuba, dashimaki tamago

items.name: Pontocho Alley
items.note: River-view dining along Kamo River ‚Äî atmospheric

items.name: Gion Kappa Restaurant
items.note: Casual Gion izakaya ‚Äî affordable Kyoto kaiseki style

items.name: Ippudo Ramen Kyoto
items.note: Famous chain but Kyoto branch is superb ‚Äî tonkotsu

items.name: Arashiyama Tofu Restaurant Sagano
items.note: Traditional tofu kaiseki near bamboo grove

items.name: Nakatanidou Mochi
items.note: Famous high-speed mochi pounding ‚Äî freshest mochi ever
